definition: a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: In 1991 India reformed because it had to.
sentences.chinese: 在1991年，印度是因爲沒有退路才發動改革的。

sentences.english: You know, I love you, there is no retreat.
sentences.chinese: 罼你知道的，我愛你，別無退路。
這一來她連個退路都沒有了。

sentences.english: When you mottled familiar escape route.
The enemy's line of retreat was cut off.
There are no retractions or future deliverances.
sentences.chinese: 既沒有退路也沒有未來的解脫。

sentences.english: Planning for an exit is the key when placing money in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中國投資時，留好退路是關鍵所在。

sentences.english: Life is long. There is always time for Plan B. But don't begin with it.
sentences.chinese: 生命很長，你永遠都有退路，只是莫從退路開始。

sentences.english: Life is long. There is always time for Plan B. But don't begin with it.
sentences.chinese: 生命很長，你永遠都有退路，只是莫從退路開始。

sentences.english: There is no retreat, but in submission and slavery!
sentences.chinese: 我們別無退路，否則只能含垢忍辱，淪爲奴隸。

sentences.english: There was no escape from the flames…They died like animals in a cage.
sentences.chinese: 火焰中全無退路，他們如籠中困獸一般死去。

definition: escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
labor/physical work
through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
a way to make a living/a way to survive/a way out of a predicament
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
to guard against
leeway/latitude/room for freedom of action
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
to sever/to break off
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to retreat/to shrink back
to retreat
to retire/to remove/to withdraw/to evacuate
